dialog: Subtitles by explosiveskull www.OpenSubtitles.org M_I_S_ForEver What do you want?
You're not drownin' there, are you, Tess?
You're gonna be late for school.
Thanks for getting the skim this time.
Don't make sense to me, pay money for that.
I thought you were supposed to be in school?
She just puts on a movie.
No, I'm not long finished my lunch.
Lisa asked me to move in.
What am I supposed to do then?
You're old enough to stay here by yourself, aren't you? It is your house.
She's got a spare room: Danny's old room.
I can ask about it if you want.
Anyway, I'm sure she wouldn't mind if you stayed there.
Gerry and I are moving into Lisa's.
You're movin' in to Lisa Sharpe's?
He's like, so weird about me staying at home alone, so I'm just goin' with it.
So you're gonna live in Danny Sharpe's house?
I think my sister still has his CD. I can steal it for you if you want.
Tess, you mind staying back for a minute?
I'm glad to see you back in school.
You missed a lot of days.
Tess, if you miss many more, you're not gonna be able to graduate.
Listen... I know it's been a really hard year.
I could set up a meeting with the guidance counsellor.
Hand me up the axe there, would you?
You're really hot, you know that?
You're the hottest girl  in our class.
One of the hottest at least.
I've been thinking about coming up here with you all day.
Put your hand on my dick.
I was just, uh, changing the lightbulb.
Oh, I haven't even showered yet.
I'm just back from the plant.
Can I get you something to drink, Tess?
There's extra blankets and stuff in the hall closet if you need 'em.

Let's stay out here for a bit.

She loves it, but I don't really like it.
I used to like it, but...
I don't want anyone to see us.
I'm surprised you actually came tonight.
Thought I scared you off the other day.

âª Well, the sky has fallen âª âª This time, it's for real âª âª Everybody's been talking âª âª Like it's a pretty big deal âª âª My neighbour's been babblin' âª âª Over there on his knees âª âª Something about the fi... âª Hello?

I moved in here with Gerry.
My mother goes out with Gerry fuckin' O'Neal?
He's my mom's boyf... well, like, was my mom's boyfriend.
Where were you at last night?
We had a dandy cabin in the backwoods there.
Just made out of scrap, really.
But we had lots of fun.
Left the stove on one night, burnt it to the ground.
Stood around and roasted hot dogs over it.
Well... I suppose this place is a bit more crowded than I expected.
Do you sleep in my room?
You don't have a place to stay?
You could stay out at my house if you want.
Really! And it's a mess but...
I mean, it's not fancy or anything but you could stay there.
It's the green and white one that's across from the plant.
Lisa's young fella showed up today.
He said that you let him stay at your mother's house.
Yeah. It was empty anyway, so.
That's kind of fuckin' strange, don't you think?
Well, he's been gone for nearly 20 years.
Must be he wants  money or something.
I'm sure Lisa would love to hear you say that.
You don't know anything about him.
If he's here, he's lookin' for something.
Maybe he just wants to see his mom.
I'm sorry if I woke you up.
I just gotta run up and get something if that's OK?
At least stay for a cup of tea?
She... she's a lot smaller than she looms in my head, I tell you.
She'll bring me to supper on Friday.
So you're staying a while then?
I... I mean, if that's all right.
It's a shitty couch to stay on, though.
What's all the news around these parts these days?
Is that good news or bad?
I'll look into the barns in a bit, if you wants to join me.
Used to get a lot of 'em up here years ago.
Yeah, I... I found some  the other day.
You be careful with them. They're powerful little friggers.
Well... in about 15 minutes, the whole harbour's gonna be talking about how Tess Small was up in the woods with Danny Sharpe.
You should, uh, drop by again sometime.
You can sleep in my room if you want.
It's really good of you, what you been doing for Danny.
He said you've been really nice to him.
Did you have a nice visit?
It's something strange, seeing him like that, he's all grown up.
Told me he's coming for supper later in the week.
With me and Gerry together, it's almost like you and Danny are brother and sister.
I used to collect things from here when I was little.
Like... beach rocks and feathers and shells and stuff.
I'd bring them home and my mom was... she'd get so cracked.
I was down here a lot when I was a young fella too.
I spent a lot of time alone.
I was there out by the river one time.
You know, where the sewage runs in there.
All the toilet paper up on the rocks like little mummies.
Used to remind me of mummies.
I saw a little face in the river.
I thought it was a fish or something at first, like half a rotted fish.
Or a... a fetus or whatever.
Could've fit it in the palm of me hand.
Did someone have a miscarriage or something?
Oh. I don't even have to go through them.
Oh, I gotta get a hot cloth.
I got it. I got it.
That's how all mine were done.
Hey, you know what I remembered today?
Me and my buddies, we all had...
Well, we all used to crush on your mama...
I guess she was a teenager then.
She wore a ponytail on top of her head.
I remember I thought it was the coolest thing.
She was nice to me too.
You gotta count to six hundred.
I was hoping you'd pick this one.
I thought you might want your homework.
You guys are in the beer, are you?
Just... give me my homework and...
I'll come over tomorrow night and we'll hang out.
So you wanna hang out with me now, do you?
How'd you know I was here?
Everyone knows you're here with him.
Evan said he saw you up in the woods together.
Good. I'm glad Evan saw us.
You know what people are saying?
You're hookin' up with Evan one day, then you're up  in the woods with him.
So you just came over here  to call me a slut.
No, I didn't! I came here to check on you because I was worried about you.
I can take care of myself.
Follow him around, be his little groupie?
You causin' trouble for my girl?
That's not gonna fly with me.
Why don't you get a girlfriend your own age, you creep.
Why don't you make yourself scarce, young one?
We were supposed to go to town on the weekend to look at grad dresses, but I guess you don't care about that anymore.
No, I don't care about that anymore.
I don't give a fuck either.
Well, I'll probably go to bed now soon.
I'll see you at Lisa's tomorrow night.
Yeah, I'm gonna take off then after that.
I gotta get back to me bar and everything.
One week in this place is enough to make anyone want to leave.
I'd... I'd say that I didn't see anything, but...
Oh, she's not having any jokes.
Something to warm me up maybe?
Drop of rum with ginger ale.
It's just a bit of supper.
Lisa'd probably be more surprised if I did show up.
We might as well spend the night here, eh?
I'll bring you over in the morning.
When you left, how'd you do it?
I made a mess of it, I suppose.
'til by the time I left, there was nobody sad to see me leave.
I don't want you to leave.
I've gotten pretty used to your company too.
If you leave, I'll have nobody.
All the boys around here and their dirty fucking fingernails.
I swear to God, if one more of them touches me, I'll slit their throat.
What was so important you had to miss supper?
Where the Jesus have you been, Tess?
I should've known that she was tangled up with the likes of you.
Danny, you said all this shit was behind us.
Look, just get the Jesus off this deck before I throws you off.
I'm sorry they were such assholes.
nothing to do with you, girl.
You look me up, you makes your way to the big city.
What the hell is wrong with you?
You wouldn't even let him speak.
Yeah, I do. I know him.
I know him really well and he knows me too.
No. Oh, you don't know him, Tess!
You don't know anything about him! Did you know that he broke his mother's nose once?
Did he tell you that one?
He was a kid when he did that!
You never wanted me here anyway.

like a sure loss, then all of a sudden,  people become a little more...

Well, I mean, gotta go to the bar first,  but later, yeah.
